title: A New Fully Integrated Retractable 4D STEM Detector for Scanning Electron Microscopes Using Timepix3 Based Pixelated Detector
content: Four-Dimensional Scanning Transmission Electron Microscopy (4D STEM) is a widely used technique, especially in Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) in advance to provide imaging, diffraction, and spectroscopy of materials down to atomic resolution. Thanks to progress in the field of electronics, a large-scale 4D STEM experiments heave become possible using Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM). The 4D STEM denomination refers to techniqueÂ´s principle: on a specimen, the probe is scanning in a two-dimensional (2D) array while the detector records 2D diffraction pattern at each probe position. Therefore, the resulting datasets are 4D [1].
